intro: Tarenna pumila, commonly known as the small-leaved tarenna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, ovate leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded forest environments. Tarenna pumila is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
